00006 namespace eval utils {

00011   array set xignore_id {}

00015     { } Key-space
00016     !   Key-exclam
00017     \"  Key-quotedbl
00018     \#  Key-numbersign
00019     \$  Key-dollar
00020     %   Key-percent
00021     &   Key-ampersand

00046     \}  Key-braceright

00051   ##########################################################
00052   # Useful process for debugging.
00053   proc stacktrace {} {
00054 
00055     set stack "Stack trace:\n"
00056     for {set i 1} {$i < [info level]} {incr i} {
00057       set lvl [info level -$i]
00058       set pname [lindex $lvl 0]
00059       if {[namespace which -command $pname] eq ""} {
00060         for {set j [expr $i + 1]} {$j < [info level]} {incr j} {
00061           if {[namespace which -command [lindex [info level -$j] 0]] ne ""} {
00062             set pname "[namespace qualifiers [lindex [info level -$j] 0]]::$pname"
00063             break
00064           }
00065         }
00066       }
00067       append stack [string repeat " " $i]$pname
00068       foreach value [lrange $lvl 1 end] arg [info args $pname] {
00069         if {$value eq ""} {
00070           info default $pname $arg value
00071         }
00072         append stack " $arg='$value'"
00073       }
00074       append stack \n
00075     }
00076 
00077     return $stack
00078 
00079   }

00081   ###########################################################################
00082   # Performs the set operation on a given yscrollbar.
00083   proc set_yscrollbar {sb first last} {
00084         
00085     # If everything is displayed, hide the scrollbar
00086     if {($first == 0) && (($last == 1) || ($last == 0))} {
00087       grid remove $sb
00088     } else {
00089       grid $sb
00090       $sb set $first $last
00091     }
00092 
00093   }
00094   
00095   ######################################################################
00096   # Performs the set operation on a given xscrollbar.
00097   proc set_xscrollbar {sb first last} {
00098     
00099     variable xignore
00100     variable xignore_id
00101     
00102     if {($first == 0) && ($last == 1)} {
00103       grid remove $sb
00104       set_xignore $sb 1 0
00105       set xignore_id($sb) [after 1000 [list utils::set_xignore $sb 0 1]]
00106     } else {
00107       if {![info exists xignore($sb)] || !$xignore($sb)} {
00108         grid $sb
00109         $sb set $first $last
00110       }
00111       set_xignore $sb 0 0
00112     }
00113     
00114   }
00115   
00116   ######################################################################
00117   # Clears the xignore and xignore_id values.
00118   proc set_xignore {sb value auto} {
00119   
00120     variable xignore
00121     variable xignore_id
00122         
00123     # Clear the after (if it exists)
00124     if {[info exists xignore_id($sb)]} {
00125       after cancel $xignore_id($sb)
00126       unset xignore_id($sb)
00127     }
00128     
00129     # Set the xignore value to the specified value
00130     set xignore($sb) $value
00131     
00132   }

00134   ######################################################################
00135   # Returns the mark of the anchor.
00136   proc text_anchor {w} {
00137 
00138     if {[info procs ::tk::TextAnchor] ne ""} {
00139       return [::tk::TextAnchor $w]
00140     } else {
00141       return tk::anchor$w
00142     }
00143 
00144   }

00146   ######################################################################
00147   # Parses the given string for any variables and substitutes those
00148   # variables with their respective values.  If a variable was found that
00149   # has not been defined, no substitution occurs for it.  The fully
00150   # substituted string is returned.
00151   proc perform_substitutions {str} {
00152     
00153     variable vars
00154     
00155     return [subst [regsub -all {\$([a-zA-Z0-9_]+)} $str {[expr {[info exists vars(\1)] ? $vars(\1) : {&}}]}]]
00156     
00157   }
00158   
00159   ######################################################################
00160   # Adds the given environment variables to the environment.
00161   proc set_environment {var_list} {
00162     
00163     variable vars
00164         
00165     array unset vars
00166     
00167     # Pre-load the vars with the environment variables
00168     array set vars [array get ::env]
00169     
00170     # Load the var_list into vars
00171     foreach var_pair $var_list {
00172       set vars([string toupper [lindex $var_pair 0]]) [perform_substitutions [lindex $var_pair 1]]
00173     }
00174     
00175   }
00176   
00177   ######################################################################
00178   # Opens the given filename in an external application, using one of the
00179   # open terminal commands to determine the proper application to use.
00180   proc open_file_externally {fname {in_background 0}} {
00181     
00182     set opts ""
00183     
00184     switch -glob $::tcl_platform(os) {
00185       Darwin {
00186         if {$in_background} {
00187           set opts "-g"
00188         }
00189         catch { exec open {*}$opts $fname }
00190       }
00191       Linux* {
00192         catch { exec xdg-open $fname }
00193       }
00194       *Win* {
00195         catch { exec os.startfile $fname }
00196       }
00197     }
00198     
00199   }

00217   ######################################################################
00218   # Converts an RGB value into an HSV value.
00219   proc rgb_to_hsv {r g b} {
00220    
00221     set sorted [lsort -real [list $r $g $b]]
00222     set temp [lindex $sorted 0]
00223     set v [lindex $sorted 2]
00224    
00225     set bottom [expr {$v-$temp}]
00226     if {$bottom == 0} {
00227       set h 0
00228       set s 0
00229       set v $v
00230     } else {
00231       if {$v == $r} {
00232         set top [expr {$g-$b}]
00233         if {$g >= $b} {
00234           set angle 0
00235         } else {
00236           set angle 360
00237         }
00238       } elseif {$v == $g} {
00239         set top [expr {$b-$r}]
00240         set angle 120
00241       } elseif {$v == $b} {
00242         set top [expr {$r-$g}]
00243         set angle 240
00244       }
00245       set h [expr { round( 60 * ( double($top) / $bottom ) + $angle ) }]
00246     }
00247    
00248     if {$v == 0} {
00249       set s 0
00250     } else {
00251       set s [expr { round( 255 - 255 * ( double($temp) / $v ) ) }]
00252     }
00253    
00254     return [list $h $s $v]
00255    
00256   }
00257    
00258   ######################################################################
00259   # Converts an HSV value into an RGB value.
00260   proc hsv_to_rgb {h s v} {
00261    
00262     set hi [expr { int( double($h) / 60 ) % 6 }]
00263     set f  [expr { double($h) / 60 - $hi }]
00264     set s  [expr { double($s)/255 }]
00265     set v  [expr { double($v)/255 }]
00266     set p  [expr { double($v) * (1 - $s) }]
00267     set q  [expr { double($v) * (1 - $f * $s) }]
00268     set t  [expr { double($v) * (1 - (1 - $f) * $s) }]
00269    
00270     switch -- $hi {
00271       0 {
00272         set r $v
00273         set g $t
00274         set b $p
00275       }
00276       1 {
00277         set r $q
00278         set g $v
00279         set b $p
00280       }
00281       2 {
00282         set r $p
00283         set g $v
00284         set b $t
00285       }
00286       3 {
00287         set r $p
00288         set g $q
00289         set b $v
00290       }
00291       4 {
00292         set r $t
00293         set g $p
00294         set b $v
00295       }
00296       5 {
00297         set r $v
00298         set g $p
00299         set b $q
00300       }
00301       default {
00302         error "Wrong hi value in hsv_to_rgb procedure! This should never happen!"
00303       }
00304     }
00305    
00306     set r [expr {round($r*255)}]
00307     set g [expr {round($g*255)}]
00308     set b [expr {round($b*255)}]
00309    
00310     return [list $r $g $b]
00311    
00312   }
00313   
00314   ######################################################################
00315   # Automatically adjusts the given color by a value equal to diff such
00316   # that if color is a darker color, the value will be lightened and if
00317   # color is a lighter color, the value will be darkened.
00318   proc auto_adjust_color {color diff} {
00319     
00320     # Create the lighter version of the primary color
00321     lassign [winfo rgb . $color] r g b
00322     lassign [rgb_to_hsv [expr $r >> 8] [expr $g >> 8] [expr $b >> 8]] hue saturation value
00323     set value [expr ($value < 128) ? ($value + $diff) : ($value - $diff)]
00324     set rgb   [hsv_to_rgb $hue $saturation $value]
00325       
00326     return [format {#%02x%02x%02x} {*}$rgb]
00327 
00328   }

00330   ######################################################################
00331   # Converts a character to its associated keysym.  Note:  Only printable
00332   # string values are supported.
00333   proc string_to_keysym {str} {
00334     
00335     variable c2k_map
00336     
00337     return [string map [array get c2k_map] $str]
00338     
00339   }
